page.title: 02HOUSING IN FENCE AND HIGHAM
page.content: THE VILLAGES OF FENCE AND HIGHAM HAVE SEEN AN INTRESTING CHANGE IN THEIR HOUSING STOCK OVER THE LAST 150 YEARS. ORIGINALLY THE VILLAGES WERE VERY SMALL AND THE ONLY HOUSES WERE FARM- HOUSES.A FEW OF THESE OLD FARMHOUSES REMAIN. IN THE "INDUSTRIAL REVOLUTION" YEARS WHEN EACH VILLAGE ACQUIRED A MILL SOME ROWS OF TERRACED HOUSING WERE BUILT (2 ROOMS UPSTAIRS,2 ROOMS DOWN STAIRS AND TOILET OUTSIDE). THE VILLAGES HAVE GROWN OVER THE LAST 20 YEARS AS COMMUTER VILLAGES FOR WORKERS THROUGHOUT PENDLE.SUBSTANTIAL SEMI-DETACHED,DETACHED AND BUNGALOWS HAVE BEEN BUILT,EACH WITH ITS OWN GARDEN FRONT AND BACK AND GARAGE. THE VILLAGES DO NOT HAVE ANY HIGH RISE FLATS OR MUCH COUNCIL HOUSING.
